Reviews.Title: Perfect.
Reviews.Author: Sergio
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of several DSLRs before buying this one because I was looking for the perfect first DSRL. I had some knowledge in photography but choosing one was very hard. The reviews, price, and features convinced me to acquire this one and I couldn't be happier. It has everything that I expected and more, great pictures; for the amateurs is very easy to use and very complete for the experienced.The only thing that I might recommend to anyone looking to buy this camera is that they should get the 18-135mm lens to have more versatility, I got it with the 18-55mm because of the cost but in the future I plan to upgrade the lenses.

Reviews.Title: My First DSLR Camera
Reviews.Author: Jenny
Reviews.Content: I got the T3i as my first DSLR camera.  The T3i has a flip out monitor which is handy so you can film and the person in front can see what they are looking while filming. It takes amazing pictures and video. I mainly use this when making youtube videos. It's a great beginner camera if your into making videos or taking photos.  I've not had any problems with this camera what so ever. Battery last for a good long time. I would recommend this if your looking for a first time DSLR camera.

Reviews.Title: FABULOUS
Reviews.Author: Midnight
Reviews.Content: I bought this around thanksgiving as a huge surprise gift from myself and a bunch of other friends for another of our friends, she was a fantastic photographer, down on her luck and living paycheck to paycheck working off of a not so fantastic little point and shoot. We all planned to get together and buy her this camera and we made a whole big ordeal out of it when she would be receiving it and it ARRIVED EARLY to my very great surprise and excitement! I was so excited that I couldn't wait any longer and I buried it in mounts of tissue paper and ribbons and headed to work to give it to her. We told her mother what we had done and she started crying right on the spot nearly ruining the surprise. At first when we gave her the present she thought it was a joke, her family didn't give each other presents and she was extremely unused to people doing genuinely nice things for her for no reason, threw the tissue paper around at everyone and then she got to the box and when she opened it she froze and just started bawling her eyes out. It was the happiest I have ever seen her, and every time she looks at that camera I see how excited she is and how happy it makes her that she can photograph everything how she really wanted. This camera ended up being wonderful and I hope it makes everyone else as happy as it did her. :)

Reviews.Title: Perfect for a beginner photographer
Reviews.Author: sfguy33
Reviews.Content: I am a beginner photographer, and so I wanted to buy a camera that has everything a photographer can use and learn with - and this one's perfect. Some of my friends have many more years of experience with cameras and lenses, and even they thought this was a great deal. The extra lens helps because if you are into nature photography or even practicing product photography, you need it.Highly recommend this to any photographer, especially the eager newbie learners like myself.

Reviews.Title: Canon T3i Review
Reviews.Author: Harry Kowalski
Reviews.Content: The camera is great. It lives up to my expections. Picturesare sharp, clean and true. I would have given it 5 stars,exceptit does'nt have auto focus when shooting video. Big mistake.If that does'nt mean anything to you, buy it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: tLEAHc
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! I'm still learning to use it in Manual mode but if I'm feeling lazy and don't want to adjust the settings for my surroundings, the Scene Intelligent Auto mode still works beautifully!!Very happy with my purchase!!

Reviews.Title: Oh man, I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Aaron "Aaron"
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before buying this camera and I am not disappointed. It was on sale on Amazon for $499 with the stock lens, excellent price! I was considering getting the T5i for the touch screen, but I believe using the buttons with practice will be just as fast if not faster, kind of like key commands versus the mouse. Other than that the other upgraded features don't make a difference to me. The $200 extra seemed too much just for that. I am an amateur videographer, when I'm a pro I'll get the 5D, I can deal with not having a touch screen till then.

Reviews.Title: my first real camera
Reviews.Author: I need to return some video tapes
Reviews.Content: i was working in london this summer and was traveling a lot and finally decided to buy this camera to capture my trips to rome, barcelona, ibiza, amsterdam.  the two lenses are nice. if you don't know much about cameras and just want nice pictures this is the way to go, or even if your just a professional.  battery lasts forever and its key that if your traveling that you buy a camera with a rotating back screen.  because for example when your walking through the vatican with 5,000 other people, you quickly realize the only way to take pictures is by holding the camera over your head.  if the folding rear screen you can fold the screen downward so you can shoot and walk.  i saw people with the still rear screen just blindly shooting around.  quite funny.  well buy this and some spare batteries and a couple memory sticks and a case.  your good to go. don't hesitate and get it before you go on a trip so you can fool around with the features a bit

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Aaron Schaefer "Schaef"
Reviews.Content: I'm not a professional photographer, but I am a professional videographer, and I can tell you that the video this camera takes is top notch. I didn't just buy it for it's video capabilities, but it was a huge selling point for me. I do take a lot of photos as well and I have been very impressed with that aspect. Canon, for the most part, makes superior quality cameras and you can pretty much expect the same with the T3i. To me, people who complain about this camera's features (or lack thereof) probably should have gone with something more expensive. For the price, I really don't think you can do much better than this camera. So, why the 4 star rating? Because I rarely ever give out 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Sweet camera and lenses; awesome deal!
Reviews.Author: Hammy Lady
Reviews.Content: Love this camera! Fairly lightweight for a DSLR (compared to my friend's Sony, which weighs a ton!). Very user friendly; comfortable to hold. Extra lens if fantastic; really happy to get two lenses at this price. Takes fantastic images! Extremely happy with the camera and lenses! I shopped around and could not find this camera and these lenses at a price anywhere close to this deal!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for taking children's pictures
Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: I wish I had taken the plunge earlier. I bought a supposedly very good point-and-shoot camera from Canon (ELPH 310HS) two years ago and thought that would solve the shutter speed issue when taking my children's pictures. But it did not. Finally I had enough of that sluggish and decided to take a look of this DSLR.Some of the reviews really make me pause, especially those suggested that if you only want to use Auto feature of this DSLR, you better buy a high-end point-and-shoot camera instead. To be honest, I don't plan to use features other than Auto. But my current point-and-shoot camera falls short of my expectation and I don't want to try a new point-and-shoot, which may be only marginally better. So I finally took the chance. I must tell you the experience so far is liberating. I could take pictures whenever I want without that dreadful delay, which ruined so many precious moments. Now I could concentrate my mind on taking beautiful pictures instead of pressing that shutter button frenetically. The only thing I don't like is the weight of this camera. However, I am more than willing to sacrifice a little weight for beautiful pictures.Since I hate to switch lens all the time, I bought the 18-135 one instead of 18-55. So far it meets all my shooting requirements. I have since taken so many beautiful pictures which I don't think it is possible with my point and shoot.  The one thing I still look for is a good all-purpose camera bag. After reading through a lot of reviews, Lowepro Passport Sling seems a good fit - easy to use and comfortable with enough storage for both camera and personal items. Will take a look in the store this weekend. My conclusion is this is a great camera for taking children's pictures.

Reviews.Title: Best money ever spent
Reviews.Author: Ruth Yanda
Reviews.Content: Oh my, we were in the keys, sunset, it was crazy beautiful pictures, color perfect, such a fantastic camera!!!!!!!!  Take a class, get all you can out of this best money ever spent camera.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera - Great Value!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: My son is in college and was dreaming of a camera to work with at home.  I bought him this one for Christmas and he is absolutely thrilled.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I am a youtuber and I make videos every week, I also travel a lot and love taking pictures. This camera is great for everything you could imagine.  I thought it was going to be difficult to use but it is super easy to work. Its shutter is amazingly fast and I have gotten great images with this camera. The battery is okay but I recommend getting a back up battery if you are going to use it a lot, so you can have one charging while using the other. Overall, I love this camera and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: herroldj
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera and the price was good, I looked around everywhere and the price of a used one with lots of shutter actions was close to the price of this one.  Pictures are clear and the ability to shoot raw is phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: Best dual use camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "jwimebb"
Reviews.Content: I got mine on sale and I have love it ever since.  I hated all the years of wasted pictures due to poor camera.  This is worth the cost for both pictures and videos.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: AMAZING CAMERA!!!!!! i fell in love, so easy to use! well worth the money for great quality pictures. highly recommended

Reviews.Title: WOW!
Reviews.Author: Timmy
Reviews.Content: Ordered camera about 3 pm on  Friday and the door bell rang at 8 am Saturday! OUTSTANDING! The camera is everything it said it would be. love it!

Reviews.Title: all the camera I'll ever need and more
Reviews.Author: raul carmona
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera at a fantastic price. It has all the features I want, the ones I didn't know I wanted  and the ones I'll never use. Very clear pictures and easy to learn how to use. I'm fascinated by it.Will buy again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: Problems with low light
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: I really really like the camera but because I use it for video a lot the  only problem I've run in to is shooting in a semi low light area can mean you can't see anything

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Bear
Reviews.Content: Good Solid SLR for an nmatuer or professional photographer.  Has great features for automatic or manual shooting.  I take wedding and party pictures with mine.  Along with a 430exII flash and a Gary Fong diffuser and my 18-200mm Canon lens I get amazing results.  This camera makes the subject looks really really good.

Reviews.Title: VERY SATISFIED
Reviews.Author: william padgett
Reviews.Content: wonderful camera . My 1st dslr but feels so familiar. Last slr was canon ftb and now I can control digi exposures like I did 35mm

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Joe Bednar
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best entry to expert camera  have used.The features are great, its smooth and ease of us is a big plus.Love the quality of the pictures it takes.

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Jabari
Reviews.Content: I live ybe cameta i LOVEEEEE IT WORKS GREAT LOOKS BRAND NEW AND INCLUDED EVERYTHING ! Thank you guys so much

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Samah
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of search trying to find a good camera with considerable price compared to 1000$ cameras until I found this one 3Ti. the photos I take with it are amazing. I mainly use it for family pictures. I am nor professional user however, this camera gave me a professional pictures. I feel happy whenever i see those pictures i feel as if i am professional photographer. definitely i recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: Hunter S "- Savoy"
Reviews.Content: The ease of use is incredible, the pictures are outstanding, and the durability is fantastic. Buy this camera if you are thinking about getting into Photography, you will not regret it. it will also teach you to use it as you go.

Reviews.Title: the best camera ever
Reviews.Author: Emmanuel
Reviews.Content: I bought it last week, i have been using it for 3 days its amazing. the image and everything.If you guys want to buy something new and great, this one is the one.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful camera
Reviews.Author: M. Prescott
Reviews.Content: This camera is great.  The lenses are good.  It doesn't have a built in flash but I ordered one. I have only shot a few shots and they are great so far.

Reviews.Title: Great DSLR
Reviews.Author: James007
Reviews.Content: I bought this in May, 2011 and never had any issues with it.  I'm not a photographer so no need to buy those expensive bulky SLR, this could do pretty much everything I need. The video quality is amazing on 1080p and with 60FPS on 720 is just amazing especially editing video such as slow motion and fast forward.The flip screen is great for recording videos, just like camcorder.  Easy to carry around, lighter and smaller compare to other DSLR out there.The sad thing though is the price has dropped down a lot.  I paid $890 in 2011 and now it's only $599

Reviews.Title: What's not to love?
Reviews.Author: Tina Williams
Reviews.Content: I'm a blogger and this camera came highly recommended by all the pro bloggers. Now I know why. I love the video and picture quality. I'm in no way an expert photographer so I totally expected to have a huge learning curve with using this but it was super easy. I recommend reading through the manuals for it though just so you know how to properly use it (If you're new like me) because there's definitely a way to take care of it properly and you can easily damage it.THis is my new favorite toy.

Reviews.Title: EOS REBEL T3i
Reviews.Author: AngelGuira
Reviews.Content: WHAT CAN I SAY? I FINALLY GOT MY WIFE AND I OUR DREAM CAMERA, THIS CAMERA DOES IT ALL!!! VERY FAST SHIPPING EXPERIENCE. I LOVE MY CAMERA!!

Reviews.Title: T3i a great intro dSLR
Reviews.Author: khaled
Reviews.Content: I am not a camera expert, but rather,VERY USER FRIENDLY: The auto mode (or auto without flash, my favorite) is highly forgiving, taking fantastically sharp images, true to color. They look so clear that I feel I'm capturing as close to real life as I've ever seen before in a camera.This kind of goes without saying at this tier of camera, but the pictures are just amazing quality. Coming from the land of point-and-shoot, I'm pretty blown away. I love it and will do my best.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Jth
Reviews.Content: This camera is great. It was a gift for my wife. Got plenty of brownie points. Great quality and awesome resolution. Perfect camera for the novice photographer.

Reviews.Title: This is an unbelievable camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Gary Lee Hutchings "Compman67"
Reviews.Content: Hard to believe that a camera of this quality is under $500....If you have complaints about this camera one of two things is most likely the case.1. You are a pro that is being cheap and expect features that belong in a $1000 plus camera.2. you are a novice and you are trying to use nothing but the auto functions. This is a very complex camera and needs a great deal of study to use properly.  There is an "auto" setting.. but if you stick to using this and do not like the results.. Buy yourself a point and shoot camera..If you area photography enthusiast looking to step up your game without breaking the bank.. this camera is amazing..

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: jacksonw765
Reviews.Content: Best dslr out there. Don't get the newer versions, they really don't offer any more functionality while costing much more. Also, get a good piece of glass. The kit lens is ok, but if you really want to make your photos stand out, you should upgrade the lens.

Reviews.Title: Best camera hands down.
Reviews.Author: Robbye Dennis
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  Built very sturdy.  It goes everywhere with me.  I like all the features and it takes great photos.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Anita M Davis
Reviews.Content: Best purchase in a long while. Could not be happier.Decided to add a class to appreciate it even more. Sweet and simple. Photos look incrediable.

Reviews.Title: Perfect choice for beginner
Reviews.Author: Shan Yu
Reviews.Content: As beginner, I am suggested to use it. It is easy for you to manage and perfect choice for beginner. You can record video even no more than 26min each time. Of course, you can take as much video as memory card capacity allows, just the length of video will not last over 26 min. I took some wonderful video of firework show in Epcot when I visited Orlando Disneyland last week! I love this camera and you will not regret !

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: jake
Reviews.Content: Great camera for anyone starting out in photography. I use mine for video a lot  and the had picture quality is awesome

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera
Reviews.Author: Dr. Elizabeth Garner
Reviews.Content: Was expensive but worth every penny. One of only three cameras sold that can do stuff no other camera can. Has an automatic setting for doing "spy" work with just a point and shoot situation which is what I needed since I know nothing about photography.  Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Brian Thomas
Reviews.Content: I like this camera and absolutly have no problem with it.  It is solid and always performs.  Great camera here

Reviews.Title: BEST SLR Camera out there in the market...
Reviews.Author: Ken Keller
Reviews.Content: Canon EOS Rebel T3i is a good camera for people who wants to experiment with video along with excellent still photography results. It is light  due to its polycarbonate body and has an excellent tilt and swivel LCD screen which helps greatly in taking photos in odd angles. It is the best SLR camera out there in the market and go for it! I bought it from Walmart and I am surprised that there is not much price difference. I had it for over 2 months and shot nearly 1000 photos.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: JSman
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife because she hates looking through tiny view finders.  Now she has a very large preview screen and the pictures she has taken with it have been much better quality.  You can also set up a grid on the view screen to help you with the rule of thirds.  The memory chips that you put in this camera can be very large and taking all of your pictures in RAW format does not even put a ding in the amount of storage memory available.

Reviews.Title: For the wanna be pro
Reviews.Author: LA
Reviews.Content: Love taking pictures prob the most user friendly camera. It's the digital camera for dummies. Perfect quality and fun little features to create perfect high quality pictures to keep for a lifetime. I think every parent should have a DSLR camera it's a great investment for the amazing quality of pictures you'll have.

Reviews.Title: Replacement camera
Reviews.Author: Zoe
Reviews.Content: Out of the box, with fully charged battery the camera does not power up.  I purchased a new battery, charged it, and the camera still does not power up.  It had appeared that some of the inside packages that contained cables and battery charger had previously been opened.  I hope that I did not receive a camera that had previously been returned for the same reason.  It is very disappointing as I wanted to use this camera for a family event this weekend.  I have been an excellent customer of amazon and I have to say this is exceeding troubling. I am returning the camera via UPS return instructions today and I hope I receive a NEW one that works.Amazon shipped overnight with a Saturday delivery, a new replacement camera.  This camera was new out of the box.  Was able to try out this camera yesterday and am very pleased with this product.  Thank you Amazon for immediately shipping me a new camera once I notified you that I would return the defective one.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: martha k. story
Reviews.Content: It is a very easy camera to use, taking exceptional pictures. Having used a Cannon for years, this is an upgrade, and I wish I had bought it sooner!  I would not even consider another brand.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: john stanley
Reviews.Content: Daughter received for Christmas, had been asking for it for about a year. She has taken some shots with it and they are extremely clear and great quality. She has also made a video or two with it and same great quality. Looking forward to seeing what all this camera will do!!!!

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: James Jimenez
Reviews.Content: Received exactly what I purchased. This is an Amazing camera. Not to hard to figure out for beginners, great for intermediates, and still decent for the professional.

Reviews.Title: great!
Reviews.Author: D.H. Messer
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying I am not a photographer. I bought this camera for my husband, so that he could take good pictures of our kids instead of being limited by his point-and-shoot. I decided on this model after reading the other reviews, and I am glad that I did. My husband loves this camera, and is experimenting with all the different modes and features.  This is a good camera for those who aren't professional photographers but still want a better picture.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: margaret hendler
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing. The instructions are easy to use and understand. Can't say enough about the image quality.I would recommend this camera to anyone looking to upgrade from automatic cameras. This will make you tap into your creative side like you wouldn't believe! The transition from a point and shoot is not nearly as intimidating as I expected. The price for the quality was exceptional! Buy it, you'll LOVE it!

Reviews.Title: Great camera...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Gave this camera as a Christmas gift...well received.Pictures were beyond what we expected...everyone was thrilled.I recommend this camera to anyone who wants professional results with their photography.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the non professional
Reviews.Author: Shellie
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use, with better quality picture than most.  This camera helps get you the professional quality without the professional cost.

Reviews.Title: Very impressive camera
Reviews.Author: Mike Gower
Reviews.Content: I gave this to my wife for Christmas and she absolutely loves it. It made me look like a hero.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the new serious student/enthusiast or back up rig for pro.
Reviews.Author: Bryan M Montford "Multidisciplinary Artist"
Reviews.Content: The EOS T31 is an excellent investment for anyone who wants and needs professional level quality without breaking the bank. When paired with the 18-55mm lense it makes a very functional pairing. The 18-55mm lense is very serviceable, but that is about as much that can kindly be said about it. It's wonderful they include the package at this price point, but obtaining a better quality optic is suggested. One of the better overall values on the market for a couple of years now.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: D. mekertichyan "dave"
Reviews.Content: I'm definitely not a pro, so won't be able to give you an in debt review of this camera. I've had my T3i for about a month now. Love it so far, it's my first DSLR so I'm still learning and experimenting. I think it's a great entry level DSLR. The pictures and videos I've taken came out great, I'm sure they'll be a lot better once I learn and get a better hang of this camera. Great quality  and ease of use. If you put in a little time of exploring the menus it's really is not that difficult to learn. I've been watching a lot of you tube tutorials etc, very helpful!

Reviews.Title: I'm not sure why I hesitated buying
Reviews.Author: David "Just a young kid livin' the dream"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after much back-and-forth comparison with the Nikon 5300. I bought it as an entry-level DSLR for use in typical family situations (kids, sports, travel, etc.). We had a pretty limited budget and I was worried that I was going to buy a camera that couldn't deliver the kind of photos I want at this price point. Happily I can say my worries were unfounded.I'm sure the Nikon is also a great camera, but given the terrific price of this camera it's the superior option.After my initial use, here's my observations:1. It's easy to use. I'm not a pro, and while I don't mind fiddling with settings to get a superior shot, this camera has done a great job in auto mode for all sorts of different scenarios.2. It's fast. Having spent years with several good point-and-shoot, I've always been frustrated with the lag between pressing the shutter button and getting the shot. With this camera, that's no longer an issue. It quickly auto-focuses, fires the flash if necessary, and captures the shot. Even better, the flash recharges rather quickly so I'm no longer missing the 2nd, 3rd, etc. shots while waiting for the flash to recharge.3. It takes great pictures. The richness of color, the depth of the photo, and the clarity of image are all wonderful and confirm for me why it made sense to go to the DSLR. I've taken tons of close-ups of my kids and can't get over how beautiful these pictures are. And using a 75-300mm zoom lens (which has a $150 discount when bundled with this camera!) I'm able to capture tight shots from across the room.So if you're in the market for that first DSLR at a modest price, you'll be thrilled with the T3i.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: katie
Reviews.Content: THIS IS MY FIRST DSLR CAMERA AND IT IS EVERYTHING I WANTED AND MORE!! GREAT AUTO FUNCTIONS AND SO MUCH MORE TO LEARN.

Reviews.Title: Here's why I went with this camera... video at 1080p
Reviews.Author: Chuck Bittner "Disabled comedian & gamer!"
Reviews.Content: On a startup by saying that I'm not a newbie camera user about a bunch of different canons, I even enjoy taking my Canon to the park and shooting people (I love that joke). I got this camera because I wanted something to do with video blogs with that had really good interchangeable lenses. What sold me on this camera over other cameras was the manual controls and the 1080p video.Really the manual controls are the most important feature to me in a digital SLR camera. Being able to adjust shutter speed and aperture are a must. If you don't understand or want more information about shutter speed and aperture filthy to ask a question to this review and I'll get back to you on it. And this camera thankfully allows you the ability to adjust both of them.For me being with you 1080p video was a most important thing and no other camera in this price range at the time of buying mine could do 1080p with manual controls. In the video looks great and the best part is that you're able to adjust your shutter speed for high light or low light situations. Another benefit to using something like this over dedicated cameras for video recording is you can change the lenses. This was the second most important factor when I decide to purchase this. Being a little slap on a 50 mm fast lens (very high f-stop) means I can adjust to basically any lighting situation I run into while recording.And the video from these cameras looks amazing when you have the lighting f-stop and shutter speed all set correctly. There's a reason that many independent filmmakers run digital SLR's as their video cameras because they just have so many abilities. And to me future proofing a purchase is very important because you can take 1080p and turn it into 720p and it looks great but you can't turn 720 and a 1080p without ruining some of the video quality so to me it was worth the hundred dollars more to get this camera over any other.I also recommend getting the extended battery grip for a camera like this. It had so much to what you're able to grip and hold on the camera to me just feel so much safer having a nice battery pack to hold onto. This is especially important if you start using larger lenses or if you're out shooting for extended periods of time. Below is a nice grip that comes with extra batteries which are also necessity.Battery Grip Kit for Canon Rebel T2i T3i T4i T5i Digital SLR Camera Includes Qty 2 Replacement LP-E8 Batteries + Vertical Battery Grip + More!!Thanks for reading!If you'd like to know more about digital photography leave a comment on this review.

Reviews.Author: V. Quinlan
Reviews.Content: I got this camera the week before Christmas - all I've ever had was point and shoot camera's, so although I liked the DSLR in theory, when I took it out of the box and realized how much I had to learn in order to understand all the functions, I was a little intimidated.But here's the good news -- The quick start guide (which is all of two pages in the included manual) was all I needed to be able to take the most amazing Christmas photo's ever.  Seriously, I took AMAZING pictures!  I'm thrilled at what I can do with simply the automatic settings and the 18-55mm lens, and excited to learn to do more as I get more familiar with the camera.  (seriously, I took 186 photo's on Christmas morning!)The only disappointment is that the included Canon software is useless.  The good news is that Picasa and I have become really good friends - I've been able to import, edit, and share my photo's using Picasa without any difficulty at all. With Picasa available to everyone at no cost, I can't see the Canon software failure to be of any real significance.I'm very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: A Great Starting Point
Reviews.Author: Alecazam
Reviews.Content: The Canon Rebel T3i is a great starting point for aspiring photographers and videographers. It's not too expensive, and it performs extremely well. However, this camera is better suited for photograhy, as indicated by the slightly restricted menu in movie mode. For photography, you have full manual control over pretty much every aspect of your shot, whereas in movie mode, there seem to be a few things missing.Nonetheless, it shoots very well, with no complaints. Just make sure you get your shutter angle at 180 degrees and your videos will look flawless.My only qualm is that at 60fps, the video doesn't record very smoothly, even with my 80mb/s SD card. There are a few glitches in the video, but it still looks fairly well.I got this camera with the kit lens, and it works, at least. You do get what you pay for, so sometimes it's not all that sharp and the autofocus is none too reliable. I have been able to get good pictures and video with it, though.Overall, this camera is great for someone just starting out, as it offers great quality video and photographs for a reasonable price. I highly recommend it as the step before going to the 70D or even the 7D.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I've owned!
Reviews.Author: Thu Doan
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR camera.  I switched from point and shoot to a bridge camera (Sony DSC HX200V) to DSLR.  I've had it for 9 months and have taken 2000+ photos with it.  It's been a great camera from the start: beautiful image rendering (not blotchy like the Sony even though they have same pixel size), really good with low light situations (I recommend using a tripod), intuitive user interface, and fairly sharp images with kit lens and the Canon 55-250mm lens.  The price for this camera is good for the quality, especially for a DSLR beginner or amateur.  I chose this over some Nikon cameras because it felt more intuitive and comfortable, especially with smaller hands.  The live view with vari-angle screen is nice.  It allowed me to take shots at awkward angles easily.  However, I don't use Live View or auto-focus often because using auto-focus and with Live View takes a long time to focus and capture images, even after I've adjusted Live View shooting modes/options.  Sometimes the camera will not capture/record the image if it can't focus.  I've missed many shots because of this.  You'll need to switch to manual focus and/or not use Live View.  The battery life is pretty good for this camera - about 350-400 images (~3 hours of shooting time).  After market batteries work just as well as Canon batteries and are way cheaper and more affordable.  The Polaroid macro filters available on Amazon are a nice and inexpensive addition to your kit (~$15).  It's allowed me to take some really nice macro shots with the kit lens and allows me to cut the minimum distance for the zoom lens (makes it much easier to shoot indoors with zoom lens).  Overall, I'm quite pleased with this camera as it's easy to use and comfortable to carry around.  I rate it a 4.5/5 stars due to the issue with Live View and auto-focus.

Reviews.Title: Great First Impression!
Reviews.Author: Ana Quintana
Reviews.Content: I don't know much about photography, but I wanted something legit to do my own headshots and Christmas cards. I've only experimented for about 5 minutes, and I can already tell this camera is a dream. I'm very very happy with the purchase, and the quality of everything. I look forward to years of use!

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: J.D.Texas
Reviews.Content: I'm having a blast using this camera. The pictures are great, and no issues what so ever. I've taken all sorts of pictures and all have turned out great

Reviews.Title: It's a beast!  One reliable little camera.
Reviews.Author: Jesse Ahmann "Uncle"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for the video feature.  The colors are beautiful and the autofocus during shooting video is silent.  I use the autofocus sometimes, but usually stick to manual because most of my video work is not working with lots of depth of field.  The sound is great through the camera, but I love the mic input!As far as photography, the autofocus is too finicky.  However, most of the time I use the manual focus anyways.  Great camera for the money!!!

Reviews.Title: High quality
Reviews.Author: Anne Alagbala
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband as a gift in July. He picked this camera because of its high quality video and it takes good photos. He says it is an amazing camera and is user-friendly.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: David R. Reitzel
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome camera for the money. Does everything I need it to do and more. I highly recommend it for all who are looking for a great digital SLR camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera-no memory card
Reviews.Author: smartinez
Reviews.Content: Just make sure you know you will have to buy a memory card, $35-$85, depending on how much storage you will need. Arrived very quickly.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Emily Nelson
Reviews.Content: Did my research and boy am I happy with this bad boy. Super easy for a rookie like me to learn and even in the beginning had great pictures (no thanks to any skill on my part). Definitely glad I bought the lens separate -- ended up getting a Canon EF 50mm f/1.8 II Camera Lens. Much better then the lenses that come in the bundle.Also got a bigger memory card to hold even more pictures.I had read reviews about the battery life being so-so but it has been great for me. I have gone on a week vacation and took pictures every day and the battery lasted the whole time without charging.

Reviews.Title: Review
Reviews.Author: vince paglia
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera due to Consumer Reports. They gave it a thumbs up, very easy to use for a beginner like me. Takes awesome pictures. The only thing I would consider is buying a zoom lens.

Reviews.Title: Family photography, First time DSLR, Entry-Level
Reviews.Author: wj
Reviews.Content: First, let me start off by saying I'm not a professional photographer and this review will not focus on the technical specifications.This is my first DSLR. My previous digital camera was a point and shoot style. We had been debating taking the plunge and purchasing a DSLR camera. Here are some of the highlights.Value: If you keep an eye out you may be able to purchase the camera in conjunction with an extra lens rebate deal. This is how I got the camera and the total package was a bargain.User Friendly: A DSLR can be intimidating with all of the buttons and options available. The camera is setup to handle a beginner from day one. All of the menus have clear explanations of the functions. The camera has a fully automatic mode. This means it can operate like your point and shoot camera until you learn the extra features. There are also separate auto functions that allow you to make some adjustments without going fully manual.Focus: The focus speed and quality is incredible with a camera like this. It’s great for taking pictures of kids. You can easily capture several shots in a row of that special moment. There’s no waiting for a slow point and shoot to achieve focus.HD Video: The camera can also function as a camcorder. The recording quality is HD. The camera has a fold out/tilting screen to make video recording easier.Battery Life: The battery life is incredible. If you use the eye piece for shooting and the LCD only for viewing the shot the battery can easily last long enough that you’ll forget when it was charged last.We’re extremely happy that we went with the T3i. It’s been getting continual use since our son was born in the hospital. We used it to do our own newborn photo shoot. All of our family and friends were impressed with the pictures on our announcements and thank you cards.

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel T3i
Reviews.Author: April A. Nollmann
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera!  I'm still trying to get used to all the wonderful features since this is my first DSLR, but it's so much better than I expected, even when taking pics in the dummy modes.

Reviews.Title: It's like I never took a picture before
Reviews.Author: Steve R. "Bookie Monster"
Reviews.Content: This is my first dSLR.  I am in my mid-forties so I recall what it was like to use a fine SLR and this camera brings me back to that golden era, except better.  I can't believe how crisp the photos look and the manual settings are superb.  I realize how the last decade of digital point and shoots has made me settle for out of focus washed out images.My biggest complaint is that I have trouble locating the camera because it is inevitably squirreled away in one of my kid's rooms.  they feel that this camera has opened up a new world of observation and expression.We shoot in RAW and edit in Photoshop Elements.You will soon want a telephoto lens.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: J. Little
Reviews.Content: I bought this a step up from a point and shoot and find it is an easy transition.  I had a Canon Power Shot SX10is and this camera has much of the same functionality with a lot more capability.  Very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera & Technology...
Reviews.Author: Angie Rogers
Reviews.Content: I went from the Canon XTI 10.1mp to this Amazing T3I 18.0mp. I'm blown away by the difference and by todays technology! I had no idea that cameras come with built in filters now. Here I am lugging around this big bag with all these extra pcs. Don't get me wrong old school filters are still the better, but simplifying my life is the new norm! So glad I broke down and got this!

Reviews.Title: Amazing photo quality and speed
Reviews.Author: Lynn Seymour
Reviews.Content: Able to capture every facial expression during special moments, auto focus takes all the guess work out and focuses on the person and shades appropriately backround objects.

Reviews.Title: My first SLR
Reviews.Author: Ferdie
Reviews.Content: This is my first SLR and been using this baby every weekend for hiking and nature shots. Shots are very clear and nice. Am sticking with Canon

Reviews.Title: I like for AP
Reviews.Author: Martin Hrdlicka
Reviews.Content: I have bought this for AP. Very good sensor, makes great images. it is very nice, light, portable and over all great camera.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Bookworm329
Reviews.Content: This is my first "nice" camera. I wanted to get something that I can have for years and can just keep improving. The quality is excellent and it's not too hard to get used too. I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: benzido
Reviews.Content: Def great for pictures, lots of features. main reason I bought it was cause this one unlike the T3, has manual control over video settings. BE AWARE if thats one reason you want or choose it.... make sure you have light. lots of fuzz will start to appear with 800 iso. i can't emphasize YOU NEED LIGHT COMING FROM EVERYWHERE! def a good for beginners or experts.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera for video and photo
Reviews.Author: steve anderson
Reviews.Content: This camera is a lot better than you think.The images from video and photo CAN be outstanding and even compare to the nicer end camers in the $3,000 range.Just make sure you learn the camera and have a few lenses. The kit lens is great too don't listen to the other people that tell you its bad.Check out my videos with the T3iMy YouTube chanel is SooperHBOMB

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Matthew J. Hodgkins
Reviews.Content: For $500, this is a steal. The HD video mode is a great start for videography if you use it right and have the right lenses and audio recorder. The pictures come out great too. Make sure you get the right, high quality lenses because those make a huge difference.

Reviews.Title: my camera is wonderful
Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for beginners like me. It is easy to use and very light. I recommend it. Delivery was also not bad.

Reviews.Title: Photography novice
Reviews.Author: B A Quiroga
Reviews.Content: I am in love with this camera. I am not an expert by any means but I have been having so much fun with my camera. Its a good camera to learn on!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Bobi  Wagner
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to replace an older Rebel camera and this camera takes amazing pictures. Does not matter what lense you have on it.  I would for sure tell anyone to invest in this camera

Reviews.Title: Canon continues to make photography fun with this camera. I expected it to be heavy but it isn't..
Reviews.Author: Joann D Boydstonpictures
Reviews.Content: this is my third canon camera....two were small digital cameras but this is my first digital SLR and after using it a week Ifind I am getting excellent results ....still learning where all the buttons are but no complaints. The battery lasts a long timeand I purshased an extra and find this keeps me always ready to take a picture...It is light weight too and that is nice.

Reviews.Title: I chose this camera to replace a Pro-shot I lost in October.
Reviews.Author: KEY
Reviews.Content: I liked the Pro-shot a lot but it was getting on in age and then I left it in a restaurant in Alabama and of course no one had any knowledge about the missing camera. I had been looking at a Rebel for some time. I read Consumers Report on cameras and that helped me get this particular model. I love the big screen to view what I had taken and the 18 Megapixels really give a sharp photo.I was disappointed that Canon did not include how to connect the camera to a computer in the instruction manual. I am always nervous when trying something electrical without instructions. I really didn't want to fry my new purchase. Everything came up roses and now I am getting ready to really work it over on a long trip to Europe. Thanks, Kerald Yearns

Reviews.Title: Good Camera fits my needs
Reviews.Author: Zophar Bussie
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because I'm a inspiring Video Director/ Producer and I wanted to up grade to a good DSLR for HD purpose and this camera with its mulitiple lens capability fix my needs and wallet!

Reviews.Title: Oooooooooooooooo!
Reviews.Author: Moon)Dawg "Moon)Dawg"
Reviews.Content: Five weeks old and it's a veteran! 4,371 photos so far! This camera has not put a foot wrong as yet. It shot 1730 photos in its first weekend of service and the only bad ones were photo bombs and some where I had not noticed that my flash batteries had died! Ste it on AUTO and mash the gas!

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: star9877
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a point and shoot camera. I'm loving my T3i. It takes awesome photos. Im learning to customize it with accesories such as speedlite, battery grip, and telephoto lens.

Reviews.Title: ONE GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Bill Williams
Reviews.Content: My wife loves it and that makes me very happy, when my wife is happy, I'm happy. It takes great pictures, we down loaded all the pictures to our computer and NOT ONE BAD PICTURE.

Reviews.Title: The only first DSLR I considered
Reviews.Author: Kyle Farmer
Reviews.Content: The T3i has everything a photographer or filmmaker is looking for in an entry-level DSLR.  Great interchangeable lenses, kit lens with decent aperture settings, awesome quality video, manual control over everything, and much more.  I absolutely love this camera for everything.  In my opinion, this is a better buy than the T4i unless you need a touchscreen or automatic autofocus.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera - Quite heavy but easy to use and takes great pictures.
Reviews.Author: A. Bhat
Reviews.Content: After years of frustration with Point and Shoots I took a big step forward and purchased T3i with 18-55 Lens. Within 5 minutes of opening the box I was taking pictures. It took me couple of days to get adjusted to its size and weight. I have used the camera a lot for 10 days now with several manual settings. So far I am quite impressed with picture quality but not amazed. I thought camera should take better pictures. That could be due to the fact that I am new to DSLRs and also the included Kit Lens has some limitations. I may buy the nifty fifty and see how good the pictures turn out.UPDATE - Changing the rating to 5 stars. Amazing camera. The only regret I have is purchasing it with 18-55 mm lens. I should have purchased body only. 18-55 is good for nothing lens. I ended up buying 55-250 zoom lens which is awesome and 40 mm STM which perfect for closeup shots and videos. Nifty fifty was extremely poor quality.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful camera, beautiful pictures...
Reviews.Author: Mariel
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, I bought it off craigslist from someone who bought it from here. They had hardly used it and needed the money. I bought it with the 15-55mm kit lens, I believe that's the one. I left some of my favorite pictures on here so hopefully you will be able to see the beautiful professional pictures I was able to get with this camera, even with the kit lens. Any questions, please feel free to ask.I've owned this camera about about 2-3 months now.

Reviews.Title: Spectacular camera!!
Reviews.Author: SpideyVball
Reviews.Content: I was tired of the point-and-shoots and needed a camera I can depend on to catch my kids teams in action. Well the first weekend I got this camera, I couldn't believe the quality of the photos it could take. I spent the weekend experimenting and I couldn't be happier with the  quality of the still shots.  beautifully clear and richer than anything that I've gotten from a point-and-shoot and the ability of this camera to capture action shots is stunning thank you Canpn

Reviews.Title: It is what you want it to be
Reviews.Author: DaveOpolis
Reviews.Content: I love my camera. The funny thing about this purchase is that I used to be an avid photographer. Got paid for photos that I loved taking...I mean...how amazing is that? But life caught up to my dream world and sadly I had to sell off my equipment. Most people might think that this would be a downgrade from my past cameras but the funny thing about photography is, if you have a camera, you have all that you need.This camera does everything I need it to do. The sensor might not be a full frame but I make up for it by using higher quality lenses.The video capabilities are great.The one thing I would have to say, as a word of wisdom is...buy a cheaper body that will do everything you need it to do (minimum). And invest in GREAT lenses. I cannot explain, express, or put into English HOW important a GREAT lens is.So if I could say buy it? 5 out or 5

Reviews.Title: At long last I can capture the memories in real time
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I'm not a photographer, maybe someday I'll learn how it all works. What I really know is that I want to remember me 18 month old son just like he is today, 20 years from now. I was tired of fuzzy camera phone pics and carrying around a little digital camera that was only marginally better than a phone seemed like a waste. The Canon just works, I point at what I want to remember, push a button and it's mine forever, period. The colors are accurate, the lines are crisp, the detail is unbelievable. It's just stupid how well this little marvel does it's job. For me, this purchase was worth it's weight in gold because I don't miss the right moment now.

Reviews.Title: Phenomenal Piece of Equipment
Reviews.Author: barry stepp
Reviews.Content: Best camera I have EVER had!! Takes amazing video and amazing photo's. I'm going to upgrade soon and get a 5D, but I will never get rid of this camera.

Reviews.Title: My very fist DSLR
Reviews.Author: Raghav Ayyamani
Reviews.Content: Had always wanted to buy a dslr. This was my first one. I am loving it from the moment i started using the camera. The shots are crisp and fantastic.. Still trying to learn some technicalities. Sometimes, the photos get overexposed even though the LCD screen doesnt show that. Fantastic camera for the price i bought.

Reviews.Title: Great crop sensor camera.
Reviews.Author: Turner. "Captain Stubing"
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd rebel line camera, and the additional options over my older model are excellent. For those who want to get into dslr photography, as well as have the ability to shoot video, this camera is a good model to go with.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic for ameteur filmmakers!
Reviews.Author: Allow Me To Be Frank
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera primarily for shooting independent films and it's fantastic. The quality is crystal clear and the weight and size make it perfect for getting in tight, small places very discreetly. I've used it to record some footage and do some time lapse videos and it's astounding me how well they're coming out.I did have a problem briefly at the beginning with video recording. It would stop after a few seconds and display the error message "recording stopped automatically", but after buying a Sandisk 32GB Class 10 SDHC card ($19.99) I haven't had the problem since.All in all, this is a fantastic camera for the price. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: GOOD CAMERA
Reviews.Author: RICHARD
Reviews.Content: SLR IS CERTAINLY DIFFERENT THAN POINT AND SHOOT. GETTING USED TO IT. HOPE TO BE THOROUGHLY PLEASED AFTER MASTERING ITS CAPABILITIES.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Gary H
Reviews.Content: It is easy to use, takes great pictures and the flip out monitor is a nice touch.  You can take great night time pictures with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Focus baby
Reviews.Author: SHCUTE Clothing
Reviews.Content: I got this because I want to capture the moments of my child, great camera along with the high quality definition

Reviews.Title: Ok, I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Dr. Z
Reviews.Content: Yes, I really love it.  I don't like leaving home without it.This camera took my interest in photography to a whole new level.  It takes wonderful pictures.  It's solidly constructed.  The menus are well-designed.  The setup of the controls is well-thought out.If you are new to DSLR, this is a great camera to start with.  However, be aware that once you cross the line into DSLR, it can be a never-ending drain on your wallet, between lenses and accessories.I got some dust on my sensor within only a few months of purchase.  This seems to be inevitable as best I can tell if you have multiple lenses.  It was a bit concerning, as there isn't a lot of documentation on how to fix this problem.  I ultimately bought a sensor cleaning kit and was able to clean it after several tries.There are a gazillion lenses to choose from.  I would consider buying just the camera body and purchase a Canon EF-S 18-200mm f/3.5-5.6 IS Standard Zoom Lens for Canon DSLR Cameras.  This is the perfect "walk-around" lens, as it gives you a great range from wide-angle through telephoto.  The less you have to change lenses, the better (see above).

Reviews.Title: fantastic piece of equipment
Reviews.Author: E. Tucker
Reviews.Content: The Rebel T3i / 600D is exactly the camera that you will expect it to be.  Feature-rich, reasonably priced, enjoyable to use and, most importantly, takes really great pictures. It's not a particularly innovative camera but it is a generally well planned one. Unlike the original Rebel / 300D, the T3i doesn't sit in isolation - there are plenty of options including the increasingly competitive mirrorless and auto focusing during live view video T4i / 650D seen here...http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00894YWD0/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&camp;=1789&creative;=390957&creativeASIN;=B00894YWD0&linkCode;=as2&tag;=stupisms-20However, in keeping with previous models in the range, it's an impressive camera for the money and it's hard not to imagine owners loving theirs.

Reviews.Title: Great DSLR for beginners
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: This Rebel T3i is amazing especially for beginners. It's relatively cheap for the quality that you get out of it. My passion for photography was always with me from a young age but I only recently really got into it. I bought this camera in future shop downtown Toronto last year December. The body is made of plastic and if it gets lightly scratched or nicked rubbing the area with your finger removes the scratch. I was blown away by the quality of the pictures this camera provided me with. It was my first DSLR ever. I used to use a Kodak 5MP point and shoot and then moved to my Sony Ericsson Xperia Arc 8MP phone. When I got this camera I dived straight into using manual mode. It is the best way to learn. I live in the Caribbean on an island called Trinidad and Tobago. It's too expensive to ship items out of the country or fix here so I needed to make sure the camera works perfectly. I used this camera in doors and out doors in very cold weather and it held up amazingly. I was a bit skeptical of the Flip screen, living in Trinidad if it broke off or damaged it would be too expensive to repair. (Might as well buy over a new camera body). My fears are no longer, I constantly flip the screen whether it's for video recording of picture taking. It's well designed and built. It is a crop sensor camera which means the lens length is longer. Multiply the 18-55mm standard kit lens by a cropped 1.6 sensor and your lens becomes 28.8-88mm. While it is true most times that the glass (lenses) you buy for your camera are what make the image look amazing because of the optics etc..I have read online many times where people cry down the standard kit lens you get with this. This kit lens is an amazing lens for learning on, so if you're new to photography go ahead and get the lens on the body. If your more of a seasoned photog well you will know to buy the camera body alone and hopefully you already have some prime glass. Checkout some of my pictures on flickr at amazon won't let me paste the link so here is how to see my pictures. In the URL type in [...]  Many of these pictures were taken with the Canon EOS Rebel T3i.Update Wednesday 20th March 2013This Camera Body is the best, I have taken thousands of photos with it already and it's still going strong. Definitely be careful swapping out lenses in any windy area that you know could potentially carry dust, dirt or sand particles that could get into your camera. I took my T3i on the beach last week to get some shots. I got down low enough to get a couple shots but it never touched the sand. However I was swapping out my telephoto lens for my kit lens and some sort of particle got onto the mirror of the camera. I could see it through the viewfinder. Got me scared I tell ya! I was lucky though I was able to blow it out on my own right there at the beach without it going anywhere further inside near the sensor. I got some awesome shots. It rained very lightly so the camera did get a few drops of rainwater on it. Stashed it in my camera bag till I got to shelter and gave it a quick wipe down. Still works. I flip the screen out more than I thought I would, up to now it's still solid as a rock. I only used one battery that day I didn't need to swap another battery in, the camera was on for more than 4 full hours and got around 550 shots that day. I did notice at times of above average use the grip area near the battery compartment did get relatively warm as the battery got hot. When I mean hot I don't mean extremely hot but you can tell the difference. Check out some of my shots on flickrUpdate- Wednesday 4th December 2013Hey Everyone, just giving a quick update. My Canon Rebel T3i will be making a year in about 14 days or so. I am still in love with this camera, even more than on day one actually. I only shoot in Manual Mode and RAW files. This Camera is a BEAST!! Since I last updated my review of this camera I have used it particularly at outdoor,water and powder based events. IN particular Hardcore Caribbean, Water Wars and Kaleidodash Trinidad. Each brought a different challenge. The hand grip area is perfect for holding for long hours. All buttons are still in tact and none are loose. The Flip screen is in perfect condition. 0 scratches and 0% failure. This camera did get soaked down at the cooler party called water wars. I was literally soaked down by a similar hose to those firefighters use. My camera was soaked, all the buttons got wet all the screen. Ended up giving it a quick dry down but seeing as I was soaked as well the camera stayed wet for that entire evening event. At kaleidodash, powders were thrown on me and got onto the camera body, lenses and flash. I tried my best to clean out the crevices of the camera but to this day the coloured powder still remains in between a couple of the buttons and the Canon logo. I used one lens in particular for these events, the 24-105mm F4 L lens which has a small rubber gasket to help fight water from getting in. The flash used for these events was the Young-Nuo YN 560 3.As of today I have clocked 26,155 shutter actuations on this camera in less than a year. The camera is starting to show some signs of wear. The front of the hand grip area of my camera is now slightly pushing out. It could be the sealant is giving way. This could be because of the soaking it got (did shoot in light rain a few times as well) mixed with the constant heat in the Caribbean. My camera screen did flicker once when I put it on but at the time it did this I was using an after market battery. I don't usually record video however i do small tests for my personal use. At times I do find there is a white noise line in the playback of the videos. Not sure what that is. The lens checks out fine. I noticed when I set my camera lens to auto focus in relatively dim light it forever searches for a subject to focus on which is too slow for me. It's faster for me to manually focus and shoot at the night parties. The highest ISO I mostly shoot at is ISO 800 but am noticing a bit of quality degradation.I am looking to upgrade to the Canon 70D for the new year due to the 'better' specs. I need the higher ISO for many of the night events I do. Double the shutter speed is a bonus even though I haven't had the chance to shoot at the T3i's max 4000. The Weather Sealing is much better for the shooting I do. If I had the finances I would have moved directly to the Canon 5D Mark 3. I don't look forward to built in Wifi or Touch screen. Especially having used my cell phones touch screen with a slightly sweaty hand. I won't be putting my T3i down altogether yet though. The T3i will act as a backup of mine when I get the 70D. I have recently met a person who invested all his money in buying a T5i and a backup T4i both brand new with some basic lenses. Had I met them before they bought what they did I would have strongly encouraged them to buy the T3i with one good quality lens and a couple extra batteries. Even though the camera isn't a year old yet and is showing many signs of wear and tear, I would say it held up pretty well towards everything I put it through. Definitely a fantastic camera.Find me on Flickr~Go to Flickr~Then type in a "/" then "photos" then "/" and last type in "suipeter"And that should take you there.

Reviews.Title: Great SLR camera
Reviews.Author: FJK1138
Reviews.Content: This camera was my first move from a Cannon point and shoot to the SLR realm.  A seasoned pro might feel otherwise, but for me this is a fantastic camera.  I was able to take great shots on the first few tries with simple objects around the house.  Once I took it outdoors, it really took some great photos as well. I really like the camera and its performance. Focusing and shooting are fun & terrific. The only draw back is the camera does not have the durability of body as do the higher end camera of Canon.  However, considering the price of a little over $ 500.00I got a great camera to compliment my equipment.  An 18 megapixal camera with lightning focusing and great results that allows me with the 1.6 conversion factor use my 300 MM to get wildlife and also use my L lens getting excellant results.I usually shoot in aperture priority especially with all my nature and outdoor photo work.

Reviews.Title: Best dslr for the money
Reviews.Author: Nathan
Reviews.Content: The rebel t3i delivers, for the money. Before this camera I used a Panasonic Lumix. (which is also a very good camera) The T3i is no doubt THE camera for beginning DSLR camera users, people just getting into the hobby, but don't want a cheaper 100$ point and shoot camera. The picture quality is no doubt amazing, the 18 megapixel sensor delivers exceptional performance. I'll upload some pictures that I've taken with it. For beginners, I strongly recommend auto settings for your pictures until you get used to the camera, and want to experiment around. The T3i is not a hard camera to master. In fact, all you need is a full battery and a good lens, and you're all set, just switch it to auto and shoot away. The screen on the body of the camera is also very high quality, on my 20d, the screen is very small and dark, therefore very hard to see in the sunlight. The T3i screen is very bright so it is very easy to see. The ports on the camera include a micro hdmi port, digital av (cable included) an SD card slot, the main storage for all your photos, a 3.5 mm headphone port and another port that I'm not sure what it is. Also on the camera is pretty good flash and a (slot?) for another flash. Overall this camera is the camera for the money, excellent.

Reviews.Title: Wow.
Reviews.Author: Hoosiers
Reviews.Content: This camera is outstanding.  I can't say more than what others have already said, but I will say this.. the day it came I unpackaged it, took a couple test pictures and said "I can't believe I waited this long to buy a decent camera".  Said it outloud, and I live alone !!About 2 weeks after I purchased this camera, the T4i came out.  I thought about returning this and ordering the T4i, but this one serves my purposes and then some.I love this camera, already have over 4,000 shots on it!!!

Reviews.Title: Great digital SLR
Reviews.Author: Steven Craig Glick
Reviews.Content: So far, I've found that I cannot take a bad photo with this camera.  I opted for the 18-135 lens, remembering that this is about double for the older lenses of the regular 35mm age (at least, I think it's about 36 to 270 mm standard?).  Someone can correct me if I'm wrong.  Anyway, I like having the versatile lens rather than changing lenses every time I want to do a more telephotic shot.  Anyway, on automatic settings, works beautifully . . . none of that hesitation that I used to get with my Olympus.  Also, like the feature that you can just turn the wheel on top to take non-flash photos (instead of having to go to the menu to do so).  Low light photos are amazing, and the flash doesn't usually wash out the photo.  So far (only had this camera for a month now), has performed well for holiday photos.  I'm looking forward to traveling with this camera (it is a bit heavier than I was used to with my Olympus, but mostly due to the larger lens, I believe).

Reviews.Title: SLR Camera for Gift
Reviews.Author: Linda A Cain
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a gift for my daughter.  This is her second Canon camera and she really pleased with this model.

Reviews.Title: A Beginner's Dream
Reviews.Author: C. Lagonick-Weitzel
Reviews.Content: I will preface this review by stating that I am not a camera expert and am still learning much of the functionality of this camera.  I do know the concepts of white balance, aperture, frame rate, f stops, shutter speed and other functions however, I am not all that familiar on their use and which settings are best for which shots.  I have worked with a higher end video camera and do know some things about shot composition and such, but again, only at a basic level.All that being said, here is my review.A simple two-sentence, simple, bottom line review: This camera allows me to capture ideas and shots, even in automatic mode, that if attempted with a simple point and shoot camera would look like garbage.  It has enabled me to make ideas I've had in the past into a reality which makes it worth the money.OK, so maybe that doesn't cut it for an in-depth review.The Canon T3i has a fairly rugged design and feels good in the hand.  It does not feel as heavy as it looks and has a variety of easy-to-access controls for adjusting all manner of settings and features on the camera.The camera is simple enough for a beginner to take a quick glance at the included guide, throw it into Automatic + mode and capture some great shots right out of the box.  However, it is also complex enough that a more skilled photographer or someone who wants to become one will have all the room they need to compose magazine-worthy works of art.The lens that comes with the camera, the EF-S 18-55mm is a great starter lens for medium to close up shots.  My wife and I purchased this camera from another retailer along with a Canon EF-S 55-250mm f/4.0-5.6 IS II Telephoto Zoom Lens.A WARNING: To those hunting for great deals out there, do not be duped into getting a package deal with a poor telephoto lens as an add-on.  Always research what you are getting, otherwise you can end up with a cheap telephoto lens that has no image stabilization.  Image stabilization is what keeps the lens and image balanced and is an absolute must for a telephoto lens.The above lenses are of the same family and will give the average photographer the variety they will need to accommodate the majority of the shots they will be taking.  However, Canon also has an extensive line of lenses in their EF and EFS family that will fit this camera body for higher image quality or specialized uses.The photo quality is superb.  The average user will be satisfied with the 18megapixel image compressed as a 5MB Jpeg file.  Advanced users will love the access to Canon's RAW format, which is literally the digital picture data as captured by the image sensor in the camera.  This allows for advanced tweaking and manipulation of the photo.The T3i does have a full 1080p HD video mode, however, I have not used it at this point in time and cannot review it for that reason.  However, I can say that if the image quality of the still images are indicative of the picture quality of the HD video, it will be a treat.Overall, I will say that this camera is well worth the money for someone looking to take a step up from the dull world of point and shoot.  It will give a user room to grow and learn more about photography.  For more advanced users it is a great mid-range option that has a huge level of control over shots.  That being said, this camera, like any tool, is only as good as its user.  The A+ mode will allow for pretty good shots without adjusting settings, however, a user will get the most out of it by learning more about photography and delving into the full feature set of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great

Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. It's fast and the pics are great. We are beginner level and bought it to take pics of our kids. It's great!

Reviews.Author: Phan320

With this camera I became more interested and motivated to take better photos. I also bought few more lenses and I Can't wait to see how much I can do with it..

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera
Reviews.Author: Jonathan
Reviews.Content: I bought this as an entry level DSLR. I'm no professional by any means, but I know enough to figure out why I got a bad shot and make the necessary adjustments to get a better one. This camera has met and exceeded all of my expectations. I certainly have a lot to learn about it still, however it didn't take long for me to figure out the main aspects of all the settings. Its comfortable to hold and carry, and the picture quality is amazing. I'm more of a family portrait shooter as well as just capturing family memories, so I don't use this to take artistic photos by any means, however after playing with it for a while I can see how it would be easy to start learning how to do that as well. So far my favorite feature is the wireless shutter release. Nothing makes the holidays photos as much fun now that I don't have to worry about setting that stupid timer and hoping that i run to the group in time for the shot. Now I can just enjoy the moment take as many photos in as little time necessary to achieve the perfect group shot. I love it!  If you're a person thats ever used the self timer alot, the remote should be a must added accessory!

Reviews.Title: Worth Every Penny
Reviews.Author: Daniel Caudill
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this product to anyone who is looking for a reasonably priced DSLR with some great capabilities. I ordered this one over the t4i, not only because of the pricing differences but because of the similarities of the functions. The t3i is about 3 steps ahead of the t3, and is right on par with the t4i. The tilting screen is great for showing off pictures without getting crowded, and the manual settings are great and easily fixed to how they are needed.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I was looking for!
Reviews.Author: Zudet
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the latest and most cutting edge intro DSLR then look at the new rebel T4i. However since canon launched the T4i the price has dropped even further making this an even better value then it was before. This is an excellent camera if you are looking to take your photography to the next level. However it is important to note what a DSLR will and won't do for you.It Will:-Give you better looking pictures. Even just taking pictures on Auto you can get some spectacular shots.-Allow you to "take off the training wheels" and have full control over your pictures-Expand your shooting capabilities with lenses for every occasion.It Won't:-Automatically make all your pictures great. You still need to compose and pick your shots.-Give you the portability of a Point-and-Shoot camera.The body of the camera is very well constructed, the buttons are all easy to reach and the live view screen is great for composing and reviewing your shots. All the advanced functionality you'd expect is there, though some of it is buried deep in the options menus. However the manual clearly explains where to find everything, so if you don't know something the manual is actually helpful in most cases.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
